body:
I have been using single spack instance/installation for `bg-q` and `x86` cluster. But today on `bg-q` I am seeing `x86` packages : 

```bash
○ → spack arch
bgq-CNK-powerpc

○ → spack find
==> 32 installed packages.
-- linux-redhatenterpriseserver6-x86_64 / gcc@4.9.3 -------------
mytestpkgA@perfmodels  mytestpkgB@perfmodels……
```

Why? Is this expected new behaviour?
title: Using single spack instance for multiple architectures
